title: Clinical Disease Activity Index (CDAI) for Rheumatoid Arthritis
description: Determines severity of rheumatoid arthritis using only clinical data, without laboratory tests

parameters.name: patient_global_activity
parameters.description: Patient global assessment of disease activity (0-10 scale)

parameters.name: provider_global_activity
parameters.description: Provider global assessment of disease activity (0-10 scale)

result.name: cdai_score
result.description: CDAI score for rheumatoid arthritis disease activity

ranges.interpretation: Excellent disease control - maintain current therapy
Good disease control - consider maintaining or tapering therapy
Poor control - urgent need to intensify therapy

references: Aletaha D, Nell VP, Stamm T, Uffmann M, Pflugbeil S, Machold K, Smolen JS. Acute phase reactants add little to composite disease activity indices for rheumatoid arthritis: validation of a clinical activity score. Arthritis Res Ther. 2005;7(4):R796-806.

Smolen JS, Breedveld FC, Schiff MH, Kalden JR, Emery P, Eberl G, van Riel PL, Tugwell P. A simplified disease activity index for rheumatoid arthritis for use in clinical practice. Rheumatology (Oxford). 2003;42(2):244-57.

Aletaha D, Smolen JS. The Simplified Disease Activity Index (SDAI) and the Clinical Disease Activity Index (CDAI): a review of their usefulness and validity in rheumatoid arthritis. Clin Exp Rheumatol. 2005;23(5 Suppl 39):S100-8.
formula: CDAI = Tender Joint Count (0-28) + Swollen Joint Count (0-28) + Patient Global Activity (0-10) + Provider Global Activity (0-10)
notes: Uses only clinical parameters - no laboratory tests required
Allows immediate treatment decisions without waiting for lab results
More practical than DAS-28 for routine clinical use
Patient and provider global assessments use 0-10 visual analog scale
0 = very well, 10 = very poor for global assessments
Moderate to good correlation with DAS-28 (Kappa = 0.533)
Widely accepted for monitoring RA disease activity in clinical practice
